<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>The forecast calls for sunshine in NYC today, but that’s almost hard to believe given the torrential rains and historic flooding that swept through the New York Tri-State region last night. We hope all our readers in the area are safe, and we’ll bring you more updates tomorrow as the region surveys the damage. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>Neal Freyman, Matty Merritt, Sherry Qin</em></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/01/strictest-abortion-law-country-goes-effect-texas?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
In Texas, Abortions Ground to a Halt
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/01/strictest-abortion-law-country-goes-effect-texas?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="AUSTIN, TX - JULY 13: The U.S. and Texas flags wave outside the Texas Ca..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDgxL3RleGFzX2hvdXNlX3JlcHVibGljYW5zX3IuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Montinique Monroe/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A Texas law <a href="https://apnews.com/article/texas-courts-78abf09bc505fd1b0a66502ff8202b79?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went into effect</a> on Wednesday at midnight blocking abortions roughly six weeks after pregnancy—before many know they are pregnant. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It is the most restrictive abortion law in the country and could lead many abortion providers to shut their doors. At least 85% of abortions occur after six weeks of pregnancy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Reproductive rights advocates were hoping that the Supreme Court would <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/01/us/supreme-court-texas-abortion.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">step in</a> before the deadline to block the law, which is more restrictive than the current precedent set by Roe v. Wade in 1973. That landmark ruling bans states from restricting abortion before the fetus is able to live outside a mother’s womb—roughly 22–24 weeks into pregnancy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Late last night, the Supreme Court denied an emergency appeal from opponents of the law in a 5–4 vote, leaving it in place.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The enforcement system is highly unusual </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Typically, public officials like judges or county clerks are tapped to enforce the law. But Texas’s legislation empowers private individuals to sue anyone who performs or helps with illegal abortions, with the ability to collect at least $10,000 in damages for a successful lawsuit.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s not only a threat to doctors and clinic staff, but also to theoretically anyone involved in the process—such as a ride-hailing driver who drives a woman to her abortion procedure.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Both opponents and advocates of the law agree lawsuits would be financially devastating for abortion providers.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“This bill is 100% about putting fear in physicians and putting fear in abortion funds and intimidating us. This law threatens my livelihood,” Dr. Ghazaleh Moayedi, an OB-GYN and abortion provider in Texas, </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/08/29/1032259863/texas-ob-gyn-my-existence-is-in-violation-of-the-new-abortion-law?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told NPR</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>John Seago of Texas Right to Life, the largest anti-abortion organization in Texas, doesn’t dispute it. “The lawsuits would be against the individuals making money off of the abortion, the </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/09/01/1033202132/texas-abortion-ban-what-happens-next?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">abortion industry itself</a></span><span>.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the Supreme Court—now with a 6–3 conservative majority—will hear a <a href="https://apnews.com/article/supreme-court-abortion-15-week-ban-5d066a9dc0030a4f8297711f341c9f5a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pivotal abortion case</a> in the fall over Mississippi’s request to enforce an abortion ban after 15 weeks of pregnancy. — <em>NF</em> </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/01/study-bangladesh-shows-surgical-masks-limit-covid19-infections?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bane Had the Right Idea
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bane in Batman" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDg1L2JhbmVfaW5fYmF0bWFuLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Warner Bros.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A first-of-its-kind study <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2021/09/01/masks-study-covid-bangladesh/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shows</a> “nail in the coffin” proof that surgical masks limit Covid infections.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Researchers from Yale and several other organizations ran a massive mask experiment among 340,000+ adults across 600 villages in Bangladesh to assess the impact of community masking on the spread of Covid-19.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">After eight weeks they found</strong>... </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The group that was encouraged to wear masks saw a 9% drop in Covid infections, indicating that community-wide masking can be an extremely effective tool to combat Covid.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>By delivering free masks door-to-door, offering information about the benefits, giving frequent reminders, and getting mask endorsements by trusted religious leaders, mask-wearing rates jumped by 29%. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Surgical masks are more effective than cloth masks in protecting against the virus. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How does it apply to the US?</strong> “I see no reason why the interaction between the mask and the virus will behave any differently in rural Bangladesh or rural Kansas or urban New York or San Francisco,” Lawrence Gostin, a health law professor at Georgetown University, said. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line</strong>: The research could have a significant impact on future policymaking, from mask mandates to strategies encouraging mask-wearing in certain settings. —<em> SQ</em></p>

<tr>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/01/apple-will-add-state-ids-digital-wallet-states?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple Plans to Put Velcro Wallets Out of Their Misery
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/01/apple-will-add-state-ids-digital-wallet-states?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="State ID in Apple wallet setup and on Apple watch" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDgzL2FwcGxlLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Apple</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You can finally throw away your old punch cards because Apple just <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/1/22652051/apple-iphone-drivers-license-state-id-arizona-georgia-ios-15?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> that its new operating system, iOS 15, will allow users to store their driver’s licenses and state IDs in the Wallet app. Apple will partner with TSA to utilize digital IDs in the airports of participating states, beginning with Arizona and Georgia.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How does it work? </strong>You’d pretty much use your digital ID the same way you use Apple Pay. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Apple </span><span><a href="https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2021/09/apple-announces-first-states-to-adopt-drivers-licenses-and-state-ids-in-wallet/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained</a></span><span> that when you approach a TSA checkpoint at an airport and tap your device, you’ll be prompted with a notification to let your device share the required info through encrypted communication.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>So you don’t have to hand over your phone or even show them your heavily smudged screen.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> On the one hand, it’s one less thing to accidentally leave in your other purse. But privacy experts have been expressing concerns about how the data will be used by Apple since the tech was <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/06/12/1005624457/apple-iphones-can-soon-hold-your-id-privacy-experts-are-on-edge?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first introduced</a> back in June. And there are questions over whether digital IDs could disadvantage those who use physical documents, and how they’ll influence interactions with law enforcement.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>Apple made its second App Store <a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/apple-says-japan-fair-trade-001443747.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">concession</a> in less than a week. It'll allow some companies, like Netflix, to direct users to sign up for subscriptions on their external websites, which would bypass Apple's 30% commission. — <em>MM</em></p>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/01/key-performance-indicators-september-2?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The remains of a houseboat are seen in Montegut, Louisiana on August 31,..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDgwL3VzLWh1cnJpY2FuZS13ZWF0aGVyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mark Felix/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>This probably won’t come as a surprise, but weather disasters have become <a href="https://www.axios.com/un-weather-disasters-cost-deaths-climate-change-25384b7a-fae0-4071-be76-7054bbd694ec.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more frequent</a> and more costly over the last 50 years, according to a new report from the UN. Extreme weather events caused $1.38 trillion in damage in the 2010s, compared to $175.4 billion in the 1970s. The good news is they’ve also become much less deadly. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“We don’t think business travel will ever return to 2019 levels.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Will Hawkley, the global head of travel and leisure at KPMG, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2021-08-31/will-business-travel-come-back-data-show-air-hotel-travel-forever-changed?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Bloomberg</a> that those heady days of consultants racking up miles are gone. With new communication tools, companies plan to spend significantly less on travel going forward.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>A comprehensive look at where America’s aerospace industry stands right now, from Boeing to SpaceX. (<a href="https://austinvernon.eth.link/blog/aerospacemetal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Austin Vernon</a>)</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/01/sweetgreen-ceo-jonathan-nemen-faces-backlash-linkedin-post?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Sweetgreen CEO Has Some Thoughts on Covid
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/01/sweetgreen-ceo-jonathan-nemen-faces-backlash-linkedin-post?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="BEVERLY HILLS, CA - APRIL 29:  Jonathan Neman, Co-Founder and CEO of Sweetgreen" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDg0L21pbGtlbl9pbnN0aXR1dGVfMjAxOV9nbG8uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Michael Kovac/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a now-deleted <a href="https://www.vice.com/en/article/wx5amz/sweetgreen-ceo-vaccines-and-masks-will-not-save-us-but-salads-might?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">LinkedIn post</a> that we assume did not get routed through the company's PR team, Sweetgreen CEO Jonathan Nemen claimed that no “vaccine nor mask will save us” from Covid-19. Nemen argued that the pandemic isn’t going anywhere anytime soon, and that we should focus on “overall health” and combating things like processed foods and obesity instead of infections.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The CDC has found that obesity does somewhat increase the risk of being hospitalized from Covid. But vaccines have been shown to reduce the risk of hospitalization by ~80%.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Many found the comments overdressed. </strong>Critics of the post <a href="https://www.eater.com/2021/9/1/22652747/sweetgreen-ceo-covid-health-mandate-anti-fat-bias-vaccines?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called out</a> Nemen for blaming Covid deaths on obesity and using the flawed BMI index to justify his views, while others pointed out that his proposal to tax processed food would largely hurt lower-income people.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Now's not a great time for any slip-ups that could alienate Sweetgreen customers, considering the company confidentially filed for an IPO earlier this summer. —<em>MM</em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Puzzle Section
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>You'll definitely find some familiar names in today's puzzle. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/01/brew-mini-entrepreneurs?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play it here</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real, and one is faker than anyone who says they hate Coldplay. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Blueberry the size of a basketball wins </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/ZL2zbg8zs5x5e/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47nc3f9b32rtuddaxzdd1qlymu5emduc5y11j042b2&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first-prize</a></span><span> at the Oregon State Fair</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMontinique Monroe/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA Texas law \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/texas-courts-78abf09bc505fd1b0a66502ff8202b79?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewent into effect\u003c/a\u003e on Wednesday at midnight blocking abortions roughly six weeks after pregnancy—before many know they are pregnant. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt is the most restrictive abortion law in the country and could lead many abortion providers to shut their doors. At least 85% of abortions occur after six weeks of pregnancy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eReproductive rights advocates were hoping that the Supreme Court would \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/01/us/supreme-court-texas-abortion.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estep in\u003c/a\u003e before the deadline to block the law, which is more restrictive than the current precedent set by Roe v. Wade in 1973. That landmark ruling bans states from restricting abortion before the fetus is able to live outside a mother’s womb—roughly 22–24 weeks into pregnancy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLate last night, the Supreme Court denied an emergency appeal from opponents of the law in a 5–4 vote, leaving it in place.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe enforcement system is highly unusual \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTypically, public officials like judges or county clerks are tapped to enforce the law. But Texas’s legislation empowers private individuals to sue anyone who performs or helps with illegal abortions, with the ability to collect at least $10,000 in damages for a successful lawsuit.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s not only a threat to doctors and clinic staff, but also to theoretically anyone involved in the process—such as a ride-hailing driver who drives a woman to her abortion procedure.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoth opponents and advocates of the law agree lawsuits would be financially devastating for abortion providers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“This bill is 100% about putting fear in physicians and putting fear in abortion funds and intimidating us. This law threatens my livelihood,” Dr. Ghazaleh Moayedi, an OB-GYN and abortion provider in Texas, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/08/29/1032259863/texas-ob-gyn-my-existence-is-in-violation-of-the-new-abortion-law?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold NPR\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eJohn Seago of Texas Right to Life, the largest anti-abortion organization in Texas, doesn’t dispute it. “The lawsuits would be against the individuals making money off of the abortion, the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/09/01/1033202132/texas-abortion-ban-what-happens-next?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabortion industry itself\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe Supreme Court—now with a 6–3 conservative majority—will hear a \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/supreme-court-abortion-15-week-ban-5d066a9dc0030a4f8297711f341c9f5a?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epivotal abortion case\u003c/a\u003e in the fall over Mississippi’s request to enforce an abortion ban after 15 weeks of pregnancy. — \u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA first-of-its-kind study \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2021/09/01/masks-study-covid-bangladesh/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshows\u003c/a\u003e “nail in the coffin” proof that surgical masks limit Covid infections.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eResearchers from Yale and several other organizations ran a massive mask experiment among 340,000+ adults across 600 villages in Bangladesh to assess the impact of community masking on the spread of Covid-19.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAfter eight weeks they found\u003c/strong\u003e... \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe group that was encouraged to wear masks saw a 9% drop in Covid infections, indicating that community-wide masking can be an extremely effective tool to combat Covid.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBy delivering free masks door-to-door, offering information about the benefits, giving frequent reminders, and getting mask endorsements by trusted religious leaders, mask-wearing rates jumped by 29%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSurgical masks are more effective than cloth masks in protecting against the virus. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow does it apply to the US?\u003c/strong\u003e “I see no reason why the interaction between the mask and the virus will behave any differently in rural Bangladesh or rural Kansas or urban New York or San Francisco,” Lawrence Gostin, a health law professor at Georgetown University, said. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line\u003c/strong\u003e: The research could have a significant impact on future policymaking, from mask mandates to strategies encouraging mask-wearing in certain settings. —\u003cem\u003e SQ\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eApple\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou can finally throw away your old punch cards because Apple just \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/9/1/22652051/apple-iphone-drivers-license-state-id-arizona-georgia-ios-15?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e that its new operating system, iOS 15, will allow users to store their driver’s licenses and state IDs in the Wallet app. Apple will partner with TSA to utilize digital IDs in the airports of participating states, beginning with Arizona and Georgia.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow does it work? \u003c/strong\u003eYou’d pretty much use your digital ID the same way you use Apple Pay. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eApple \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2021/09/apple-announces-first-states-to-adopt-drivers-licenses-and-state-ids-in-wallet/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplained\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that when you approach a TSA checkpoint at an airport and tap your device, you’ll be prompted with a notification to let your device share the required info through encrypted communication.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSo you don’t have to hand over your phone or even show them your heavily smudged screen.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e On the one hand, it’s one less thing to accidentally leave in your other purse. But privacy experts have been expressing concerns about how the data will be used by Apple since the tech was \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/06/12/1005624457/apple-iphones-can-soon-hold-your-id-privacy-experts-are-on-edge?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst introduced\u003c/a\u003e back in June. And there are questions over whether digital IDs could disadvantage those who use physical documents, and how they’ll influence interactions with law enforcement.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here: \u003c/strong\u003eApple made its second App Store \u003ca href=\"https://www.yahoo.com/news/apple-says-japan-fair-trade-001443747.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econcession\u003c/a\u003e in less than a week. It'll allow some companies, like Netflix, to direct users to sign up for subscriptions on their external websites, which would bypass Apple's 30% commission. —
